Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and I consistently find it to be clean, friendly, and convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Staying Here If At All Possible!”
Reviews.Author: hoylana
Reviews.Content: My mother booked this hotel for us for one night in advance when we knew we would be coming in on a late flight and wanted something close to the airport. The next day we were headed to another destination, and thank goodness for that! The shuttle service to the Days Inn was very touch and go from the airport. Although the driver himself was friendly, the hotel staff did not notify him of our pickup in a timely manner which left us waiting at the airport much longer than expected after a late flight. Once we arrived at the hotel, the service was incredibly cold and upon entering the room we were shocked at its condition. At first it was difficult to tell if the room had even been cleaned as pillows seemed to have just been thrown on the bed. Thankfully, the room at least smelled clean even though the air conditioner didn't work well and there were cracks running from one wall to the other. The next morning while checking out, a woman and her two young children entered the lobby after having just seen their room. The woman said "This place is disgusting- there is no way we are staying in that room." She proceeded to ask reception for a cab to take her to another hotel. That pretty much sums up our experience. As for the cost, I don't consider $90 cheap for a room in this condition, surrounded by what seemed to be a very seedy neighborhood. I have never written a hotel review before, but this experience needed to be shared. Due to this hotel, I will not be staying at another Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Phoenix on a quick business/vacation trip. We have stayed at Days Inns (other locations) before they have been pretty nice for motels. We booked the motel for 4 days and that was a mistake. First, thing we noticed was the horrible location. It is surrounded by strip clubs (the really gross kind), trashy motels, and a prison about a block away. People staying there seemed to be nice and mistaken travelers like us, but it appeared more like the place you would take a prostitute (no joking). The staff was friendly, but kind of short with guest. The lobby/check-in building looked nice, new furniture, and a small business center, with an ancient computer. We didn't even brother with the crappy free breakfast. The room looked clean at first, but on closer inspection was really gross. The bed did seem to have fresh sheets, but there were a few stains and lots of wholes. The pillows were gross and flat, meaning they have not been replaced in a long time. The furniture looked nice but was really cheap, I sat my small travel bag on the table and it wobbled and almost broke. The bathroom was the worst. The tub was gross and stained. They tried to cover it with a white rubber mat but you could still see it. The tub had hairs in it (EWWW!!). They window was gross and cover in dead flies. And they didn't even bother putting a new roll of toilet paper in. We ended up staying one night because we had to. The next day I found family members to stay with for the rest of the trip. The hotel would not refund our money. What a waste. I wish I had read more reviews before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but still not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Danip07
Reviews.Content: The only good thing you could say about this place is it is close to the airport. Other than that, it is a mess, clogged sink, not particularly clean, furnishings very dated.

Reviews.Title: “This Motel Is Meant For Desperate People”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy M
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this room for one night because of a mix up in transportation. When I phoned through the airport the man who picked up I could hardly hear anything he was saying on the phone. I got someone to pay for my room online because I didn't have much money on me. But when I got there the manager refused to let me have a room because I didn't have the credit card present on me, I understand where he comes from with credit card frauds and what not, but him belittling me made me upset. I ended up using what little money I had left to pay for a room. When I got into my room I could hear everything happening to the left and right side of the walls. When I checked for internet WiFi like they advertised all connections were locked. I looked around and found nothing that told what the password was. I only got probably two or three hours of sleep and the loud bangs of people opening and closing their doors throughout the night drove me nuts. In the morning I went down for the free breakfast they advertised. No eggs or toast, just bran flake cereal and OJ. The only thing good about this motel was probably it being clean. But if I ever get stuck in Phoenix again, I am NOT staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: Tub didn't drain, tv had color wheel problem and picture was purple. told manager but he didn't do anything about it. Coffee was in room but there was no creamer or sugar. Told manager and he told me that he would make sure it was put it room. never was. Walls were paper thin and heard every person that walked by or close to room. Near train and heard train whistle in middle of night. Would never stay here ever again!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY CLEAR - FALSE ADVERTISERS”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: First off, let me state that I travel to and stay over in the Phoenix area to visit and help care for my mother quite often. My friend and I decided to try this location due to the internet photo with the pool and the brand reputation for this motel chain. Okay, the room was filthy. There was a large hole in and other areas of the carpet raised and mushy (not wet). There were burns and holes on the ironing board. There was rust on most metal surfaces in bathroom and large holes in the wall above the light fixture. They have iron bars on the bathroom window with a view of the low income apartment/motel front doors only 30 to 40 feet away. The lamp shades were dirty and broken. The dresser was old and too small for the size of the room. Besides the filthy walls throughout, there were large cracks. Some cracks had been filled but had not even been painted over. There was no fridge, microwave, or coffee maker in our room. There was a bad, musty odor from the A/C unit and the filter was nasty (my friend developed strep throat and I also got a bad respiratory infection although it could've been from the front desk person who was very ill. She was using the lobby guest computer often and also set up the continental breakfast the next day. She coughed a lot and never once covered her mouth or sanitized her hands in our presence). There appears to be permanent dwellers onsite with very dirty covered and not covered vehicles in the lot. These vehicles appear to have not been moved in many months at least. The large areas which used to be a pool and picnic area are just dirt and weeds with some palm trees and a couple of old, unmaintained BBQs. There were piles of ashes (from the barbeques?) being dumped in the dirt filled old pool. In the morning, there was trash and beer cans strewn around the parking lot and near the rooms (it was all still there when we left at 1030am). There was dead shrubbery along the walkway outside of rooms. Our beds were clean and very comfortable. This is a great ghetto place if all you want is a bed for 60 dollars a night. You also get a strip club right across the road, porn shops nearby and a drive-thru liquor store 2 blocks away. This was probably a nice place as in the advertisement photo(s) they use, but that would've been a long time ago.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lance g
Reviews.Content: I came into phoenix last night ( for a weekend wedding ) and had a one night stay at the days inn. I arrived at the airport and called for the shuttle. Shuttle came quickly and I was at the hotel at no time. The following morning I asked the desk clerk if it would be ok If the shhuttle can drop me off to the rental car location ( which is not by the airport ). The desk clerk mentioned that the shuttle drop off is for airport only and she will see what she can do. After five min the shuttle was ready to take me to get my rental car. Good service, clean rooms, and cheap price....would come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel had no elevator”
Reviews.Author: specialedwanderer
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Phoenix airport at midnight and had to wait for the shuttle driver to wake up and pick me up. The same driver took me to the airport the next day so he must live there and be on call all the time. I had to wait, therefore, a while to get to the hotel. The hotel was clean and a reasonably priced place to stay for a lay over. There is no elevator so I had to carry my bags up the stairs by myself. Breakfast consisted of bad coffee, juice and sweet rolls wrapped in plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your eyes closed”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaJGF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night as a layover between flights. I chose it because it was a Days Inn, which is usually pretty standard, it was one of the best prices around and all I needed was a place to sleep. I got in around 11:30PM, so thankfully I didn't have to spend much time here. The good news is, there is a shuttle that will come to get you (reeking of cigarettes) and the manager was a nice guy. However... this is a place that's best experienced for the minimum number of hours possible. It's in a horrible area and the place is very much an unkept pit. It's the kind of place where you don't want to take your shoes off and you get the feeling you're better off sleeping in your clothes... maybe standing right next to the door so you can beat tracks out of there the minute your alarm rings. And, you better start off in a good mood when you get here, because this is the kind of motel that taxes a person's soul and make one contemplate stepping into the hereafter. That said, the air conditioner worked, the place was quiet, the shower was clean, the shuttle driver was prompt the next morning, and I got out of there before morning's light.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mtlemmon
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its proximity to Sky Harbor Airport and downtown. The room assigned to me was neat, the staff were nice and all my requests were fulfilled. I didn't encounter any "terrible"situations as commented by others. This hotel is worth the money and is recommended to business travelers if you have early flight in the next day, coz it's really close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RachalWine
Reviews.Content: these people are high .. This was actually a really nice hotel .. with really good service ... so the neighborhood is bad but the hotel is great!!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: sollasallew
Reviews.Content: Dirtiest hotel room I have ever stayed in torn sheets cigarette burns. No help from the staff, no possibility of changing to a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Place should be shut down!”
Reviews.Author: shakor
Reviews.Content: Very dangerous location, dirty, felt completely ripped off! Should not have the name Days Inn. Should be called Crap Hole! Don't book here! Airport shuttle dude was sleeping and rude when we called and crappy van was smoked in. Disgusted!

Reviews.Title: “won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl22
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really expensive for whatw we had. The bathroom was disgusting and the room really noisy. At first they even gave us the key of a room that hasn't been done yet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place I'd choose again”
Reviews.Author: stmalo67
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here on previous trips mostly because of the proximity to Sky Harbor Airport, but this recent trip will be the last. It has certainly gone down hill from last time we stayed - I admit it was a while ago, but really - the pool is filled in, the rooms look tired and tawdry and the neighborhood has changed in a negative way. Find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!!”
Reviews.Author: Raychelc
Reviews.Content: The office even smelled bad. When I called to confirm, it took 30 rings before anyone answered which should have been my first clue. The room was AWFUL. It smelled like something had died in there. The carpet was about 40 years old, green, torn, stained and disgusting. There was filth on the walls. The bathroom counter was stained, there was no coffee maker. The toilet and tub looked filthy. Stains all over the walls. Even the phone book I used to book another room for the night was falling apart and so dirty I felt the need for antibiotics. It's not about price..for a similar cost, there are CLEAN rooms nearby! On my way out (I lasted abou 20 minutes) I noticed the filthy, rundown strip club across the street. Gross! Oh, and I found it funny that the ice machine is unplugged/broken yet they give you an ice bucket in your room. The TV was small, old and didn't work. I tried opening a window while I was calling different hotels, but it wouldn't open so I was stuck with the intense stench of the room. It was HORRIBLE. Don't waste your money, you'll end up booking another room and running away as fast as you can like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: wjakoby
Reviews.Content: Not worth saving the money. Locks broken, not a great area....stay away!

Reviews.Title: “If You value your safety -do not stay here'”
Reviews.Author: peggy2720
Reviews.Content: I will tell you plain and simply. DONT STAY HERE. This is a filthy motel in an unsafe neighborhood. I had the misfortune to stay in this motel. I needed to make a long distance phone call. I had to walk 2 blocks to buy a phone card. On the way I was approached by vagrents and street people. Do not think of going out onto the street. During the night someone was knocking on my door and trying to look through my window . It was terrifying as I was by myself. Next day I went to breakfast to find that the City had suspended the licence to serve food. I did not get a reason why. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world and I have to say THIS IS THE WORST OF THE WORST.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl52662
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were booked at the Days Inn for one night. We arrived very late as our plane was delayed due to weather. As we drove down Van Buren ave I got a sick feeling in the pit of my stomach.......I could see this was not a safe area. When we arrived at the hotel (poor excuse for a hotel) we found the front door locked, you had to ring a doorbell for service. I reluctantly filled out the paperwork being I was already booked and it was very late. Once in the room we found it to be filthy, not to mention the air conditioner was not working properly. I called the front desk and they sent a very scary looking man to our room to fix it. My friend and I were afraid if we stayed after that encounter we might get an unwanted visit from this character, we got out of there as fast as our little feet could run. I ate the $74.00 Decided it was worth our safety. When I went to the office to tell the guy we were not staying, he argued with me telling me it was a very safe place to stay......sure thats why he locks the front door at night. I have a feeling they make alot of money off people who book and don't stay when they see what they are getting. My friend and I hit the I-17 north and drove a few miles up the road and found a very nice Ramada Inn for less money than the pig hole. The Ramada was in a much nicer section of town. This Days Inn should not even get a rating

Reviews.Title: “OMG NASTY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjakoby
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel EVER....i called ahead to find out about the area...was told it was a nice area...LIE!!! Across the street is a strip club….hookers all over the street. The window in my room did not close, so I had to rig it with a hanger. I was scared to leave my rental car outside. When pulling in there was a stack of nasty mattresses outside in the parking lot close to my room. Manager would not give me a refund so I could stay at another location. I called the customer service number….they were no help. I’m pretty sure that by judging from the neighborhood that the only thing the locals use this hotel for is to deal drugs and meet up with hookers. PLEASE DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, clean, friendly, and good value”
Reviews.Author: krumpterb
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood is improving -- old buildings have been razed and new construction in progress. It is still an industrial area, but its close location to the PHX airport and low rates make it a real value. The rooms were all completely renovated within the past year or so. Front desk staff is positive and helpful, When ice machine temporarily malfunctioned, the manager sent out for bags of ice to accommodate guests. The machine was fixed the next day. Rooms are spotless and well maintained -- Inn workers pay close attention to detai and all were very friendly and personable. We stayed at this Inn for two nights to tour Phoenix before our 5:30 AM flight home to Virginia on May 11.at the end of our month-long sightseeing vacation in AZ, CA, and NV. We were very pleased with this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach r us”
Reviews.Author: isurvivedthedaysinn
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the hotel at 2 (after feeling like we were guna get shot walking there) our room stil wasn't ready for us for another 20mins. The beds were like rocks. Breakfast is basically frosties and orange juice....yum. At least there's many places for kids to visit, such as the state prison, a run down strip club and also jack in the box (a fast food restraunt which destroyed our insides). Whilst gettin a taxi back from glendale even the driver said 'this is not a good area' and as we got closer, ' this is really not a good area, u guys better be safe'. Nice. The next morning a cockroach came out of the bath drain hole to meet us which added to the company. We asked at the reception about buses and transport etc and the staff melina and anthony knew buggar all. Melina was a right moody... Anyway on a possitive the room was big enough to wrestle in tho.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: outdoors4fun
Reviews.Content: Do not trust Days Inn photos and Starburst rating on this one! Bad neighborhood, question whether the room was clean - dark smudges resembling BM on the bathroom wall. Awakened at 3am by a group of men talking loudly and laughing outside our door. Obvious female soliciation happening on property.

Reviews.Title: “Okay property, good staff”
Reviews.Author: between_lives12
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that this place was not going to be great. The location was near to Sky Harbor Airport, interstates and Papago Park. The area was industrial. The motel looked shabby from the outside. The staff I met were all very nice and really helpful. Absolutely no complaints there. I stayed in room 202, which was a lot bigger than I expected. Well maintained and clean too. Security was lacking with several sketchy guys hanging around at night. I locked up and jammed a chair under the door knob, but never had an incident to warrant it. Just my solo female traveler flags going off. The free breakfast was quite basic. Cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee, tea, milk, muffins, doughnuts. Nothing flashy, but it was good and filling. I wasn't looking for an elaborate meal, but fresh fruit would've been appreciated. There was an outdoor pool, but was closed for the season. PROS: Staff, room size, near to things to do. CONS: Badly hung outside door that left a 2 inch gap at the bottom (glad it was too cold for bugs), didn't feel very secure. I spent 2 nights and would go back. Not good for those who want Super 8 or higher quality. Very good for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “It was not the best, but it was good.”
Reviews.Author: txshebear
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bed was hard as a rock. The breakfast wasn't all that great. But I guess for the cheap price, it was OK I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel in an even worse location”
Reviews.Author: Iflyeverywhere
Reviews.Content: Once arriving back into phoenix from a long drive from the Grand Canyon, we decided to stay somewhere less expensive because we were leaving to airport the next day. What a horrible place this hotel was at. As we got closer and closer, we felt the area became more degenerate. No lie or exaggeration, but as we were going to the hotel, we saw crack wh0res on the the corner, stares from people standing outside in the streets with their shirts off, and loud music blasting from old beat up cars. Upon arrival the hotel is directly across from a run down strip joint, as seen from the outside. Checkin was fine, the room was ok for what I expected for $35 a night. With the exception of the bathroom. The window would not shut and remained open but its ok because there were metal bars on the window, so no one could enter/escape. The bathroom was dirty but the icing on the cake was the stale sitting water that was underneath the plastic form material on the floor of the tub. It felt like you were standing on a water bed. The WORST part of that was the awful smell of that sitting water mixed with god know what else that's been sitting there for who knows how long. It was so bad that I tried to hold my breath as often as I could. If you don't shower you would have never know because the smell starts as you step into the tub and the water moves around. When the water is turned on, it only adds to the sitting water beneath the tub. I feel sorry for the person the day it busts and horrible smelling and bacteria infested water spills out onto the person bathing. Other than that and being in a run down ghetto area in Phoenix, the staff was nice and shuttled us to and from the airport by the live in driver. The gentleman at night was nice but the Russian lady at checkout was just whatever, no personality, no smile, nothing at all from her, no having a nice day, thanks for staying, NOTHING. If I was to stay again, I would bring a gun for security, not shower, and wear a bio-hazard suit.
